intro: Erigeron trimorphopsis, commonly known as the three-form daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy white ray flowers surrounding a central cluster of yellow disk flowers, typical of the genus Erigeron. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a pollinator attractant, with its flowers providing nectar to various insects.
